column2: Blood of The 500 Companions
The 500 Companions were First-Era warriors that sailed from the frozen land of Atmora to visit swift, bloody vengeance upon the Falmer of Skyrim for the "Night of Tears".
Blood of Prophet Veloth
Veloth "The Pilgrim" is known as the de facto leader of the daedra-worshiping Chimer in their exodus from Alinor to Resdayn, later known as Morrowind.
Blood of Hortator Nerevar
Nerevar "The Captain" was named Hortator, military leader of all Dunmer, after he defeated the invading Nordic Empire. He died mysteriously at the end of the War of the First Council.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Harbinger of The 500 Companions, Ysgramor decimated the local Falmer populace and established the Kingdom of Skyrim, becoming its first King.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Alessia was the blessed leader of the slave revolt that overthrew the local Ayleid overlords and eventually become the first Empress of Cyrodill.
Blood of Clan Direnni
The Direnni are a fabled Altmeri clan that ruled over most of High Rock during the First Era, winning a phyrric victory against the Alessian Order.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Eplear became the first recorded King in the history of Tamriel after he united the hundreds of Bosmer tribes and formed the first unified political identity of Valenwood.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Red Eagle, or Faolan in the language of the the Reach, was an ancient king who rallied his people and drove back the armies of Cyrodiil in the First Era.
Has reclaimed Faolan's legacy
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Frandar Hunding was a famous Ansei who led the War of the Singers against the rulers of Yokuda, leading to the establishment of the first Redguard colonies in Hammerfell.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Ruler of Alinor in the Second Era. He was believed to be a direct descendant of the Divines who created Nirn and his rule is remembered as a long and great one.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Bendu Olo was a great Hero of the Colovians who led the All-Flags Navy in an attempt to exterminate the Sload who had unleashed a great disease upon Tamriel.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Of fabled origins, Reman I was able to unite Cyrodiil after the fall of the Alessian Order and founded the Second Cyrodiilic Empire.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Rislav was a great Colovian hero who led an united army from Kvatch and Skingrad against the Alessian Order, winning a seemingly impossible victory.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Alandro Sul was the shield-companion of Nerevar and fought with the hero at the Battle of Red Mountain, where he became blind and went on to live with the Ashlanders.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Varen was a proud son of Chorrol who rose to become Emperor of Cyrodiil when he overthrew Leovic, the last of the Longhouse Emperors.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Of mythic origins, Tiber Septim was proclaimed Dragonborn, became the first Emperor of the Tamrielic Empire and ascended to godhood as the Ninth Divine.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]

Orgnum "the Wizard-King" ruled Pyandonea as a personified deity for millennia after [GetOrgnumHerHis] failed insurrection against [GetOrgnumHerHis] Aldmer overlords doomed [GetOrgnumHerHim] to [GetOrgnumHerHis] mist island.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
A family of merchants, the Gardners are generally considered to be the "founding" dynasty of the Kingdom of Wayrest.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
House Tharn is an ancient and noble family. They held estates in and around the Nibenay Basin since the early parts of the First Era and loyally served multiple Emperors.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Arlihamera, the daughter of an eminent Crown, was one of two wives to High King Ar-Aza1 of Hammerfell and a ruthless general, known to consort with assassins.
Blood of Phyllocid
The Phyllocid, one of the noblest dynasties of Hammerfell, ruled as High Kings during the Second Era, guaranteeing their throne by marrying into rivaling political factions.
Blood of Ansei [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
The Ansei, or Swordsingers, have the ability to manifest a sword from their very soul, known as a Shehai, and have been prominently involved in most of Redguard's history.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
An Ansei hero of the First Era that revived the teachings of Frandar Hunding to defeat a horde of giant goblins that poured into Hammerfell through a tear in space-time.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
A skilled Ansei warrior betrayed by her Breton allies in a great war against Orsinium, she personally slayed King Joile of Daggerfall to enact revenge.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Thagore cemented Daggerfall's place as a major kingdom in High Rock after he led the defeat of the Army of Glenpoint. Since then, Daggerfall has been a bulwark against the Orsimer threat.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Ruler of a militarized Anequina, Keirgo co-founded Elsweyr when he married Eshita of Pellitine.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Ruler of Pelletine, Eshita co-founded Elsweyr when she married Keirgo of Anequina, uniting the two feuding crowns as a single clan.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
King of Anequina in the First Era, Darloc conquered much of northern Elsweyr and northwestern Valenwood, funding the construction of several monasteries.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Keshu was a celebrated hero from the Second Akaviri Invasion and the Three Banner War. She eventually founded a movement for the advancement of Saxhleel society.
Blood of Red Bramman
Red Bramman was an infamous First Era brigadier based in Black Marsh, who gained notoriety due to his piracy against the Alessian Empire in Topal Bay.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
The Skjoralmor are an ancient Nord clan, the founders of Falkreath. With Colovia's aid they successfully defended their hold from Orcs and Reachmen alike for generations.
Blood of Bravillius
Teo "Bravillius" Tasus was a fabled Nibenese centurion of the Alessian Empire that conquered an important Ayleid stronghold and founded Bravil in its place.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Duorcorach "the Black Drake" led a united Reachmen army into a swift conquest of Cyrodiil, where he crowned himself the first of the Longhouse Emperors of Cyrodiil.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
The Last King of the Ayleids, not only he survived the original Ayleid massacre but also heroically leaded the armies that repelled the Alessians from High Rock.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
One of the oldest dynasties of all of Tamriel, the Rilisar inherited Firsthold directly from Torinaan, said to be the first Aldmer to ever set foot on Alinor.
Blood of Imbel
An ancient Breton dynasty, known for its vampiric roots and its penchant for intrigue and subterfuge as means to solve any dispute.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Born as heir to a middling Dochi in the chaotic west of Akavir, Onida sculpted Gorling to be a realm that could match the might of Gorkota.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Tanis was born the youngest child to a middling house. Few would have imagined that this child destined for obscurity would go on to unite two of the largest Tsaesci Realms under a single banner.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]

Hisashi ruled the last remaining Akaviri stronghold in his people's ancestral lands. A renowned general and master of guerilla warfare. During his time no invader was ever successful, no matter how much they outnumbered his own forces.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Lyra was the first Akaviri queen of Rimmen. Through collaboration with the Mane of Elsweyr, she saved her people from genocide at the hands of the Sossildor Emperors.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Born to the rulers of Gucun and Beidao, Yuch was nearly successful in uniting the tiger-people of Akavir under the empire of Ka Po' Tun.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
A skilled diplomat, Tamoga was one of the first Mo to successfully organise a united front against the predations of the snow-demons of the south.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
A skilled commander from a noble family, Uruku found far more excitement leading expeditions into the lands of the Kamal than waiting in line for the throne.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]

A renowned Kamali Mage who united much of the realm of Karabozut. A Necromancer by tradition, his rule undid some of the stigma surrounding the Winter Winds and the snow demons they are once purported to have worshipped.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
A warlord whose ability was matched only by their ambition, Ada'Soom united the Kamal and led an invasion of Tamriel.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
Descended from the survivors of Ada'Soom's invasion, Irmaku managed to surpass her predecessors and carve an Empire from the heart of Tamriel, at least for a time.
Blood of Ros the Half-Giant

An Atmoran, said to be the son of a Giantess and a great Warrior. After half a life of adventuring, he led an expedition out of Atmora and discovered an archipelago plagued by Goblins that was to be known in later times as Roscrea. There he founded a settlement and diligently cleansed the island of all Goblin-kind.
Blood of Yashnag

A great Chief who, after the sacking of Orsinium during the early second era, led his people into the Falkreath region of Skyrim. There he carved out a Kingdom for himself and set about pillaging the surrounding lands. He was eventually defeated and his people scattered.
Blood of the Wild Boar

Baloth Bloodtusk is a first-era cultural Hero of the Orcish peoples. A leader of a mercenary troop known as the Savage Sons, he was a renowned warrior in his day. In 1E950 he faced the great Gaiden Shinji in a duel and was slain, but also slew his opponent. Followers of the two combatants laid them to rest in the same tomb built at the site of their battle.
Blood of Turog the Great
The founder and first King of Orsinium. Under his rule it grew from a few mudhuts into a great Kingdom able to match, and in many cases even exceed the surrounding realms in might.
Blood of [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]
The holy-touched bloodline of the first Emperor of Tamriel, who ascended to become the Ninth Divine.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Godslayer
[This.GetFirstName], the one who faced the Wizard-King of Pyandonea and self-proclaimed God in personal combat and slew him.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Reclaimer
Centuries after the Ayleids lost most of their power in Cyrodiil, [This.GetFirstName] reclaimed the province and reformed Ald Cyrod.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Reclaimer
Millennia after losing Skyrim to the Nords, and being corrupted by the Dwemer, [This.GetFirstName] reclaimed the land of Skyrim, renaming it Falmereth.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Reclaimer
[This.GetFirstName], leader of the long-lost Dwemer, reclaimed Morrowind and proclaimed the restoration of Dwemereth.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Reclaimer
Millenia after the Dunmer betrayed their land and their gods, [This.GetFirstName] landed back on Resdayn and reclaimed it for the untainted Chimer.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName] the Reformer
[This.GetFirstName] brought peace, freedom, justice and security to the reformed Imperial Commune.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], Winner of the Three Alliances War
Emperor [This.GetFirstName] won the Three Alliances War, leading the alliance of Bretons, Redguards, and Orsimer in Cyrodiil to claim the Empire.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], Winner of the Three Alliances War
High King [This.GetFirstName] united the Dunmer, Nords, and Argonians after the Kamal Invasion. After their victory in the Alliance War, they destroyed the Empire in Cyrodiil.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], Winner of the Three Alliances War
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick], crowned Eagle Primarch of the Aldmeri Dominion by the Altmer, Bosmer and Khajiit, reclaimed the Altmer former glory in the Three Alliances War.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], Defender of Cyrodiil
Against all odds, [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] defended Cyrodiil and defeated all the other factions during the Three Banners War.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Azura's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Boethiah's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Clavicus Vile's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Hermaeus Mora's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Hircine's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Malacath's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Mehrunes Dagon's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Mephala's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Meridia's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Molag Bal's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Namira's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Nocturnal's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Peryite's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Sanguine's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Sheogorath's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] ended Vaermina's invasion of Nirn, saving the world and the generations to come.
Blood of [This.GetFirstName], the World-Savior
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] managed to find and use the Amulet of Kings to light the Dragonfires, ending the Daedric efforts to invade Nirn.
Blood of the Slaver
Countless slaves have been captured under the rule [This.GetFirstName]. All fear [This.GetHerHis] raids, leaving burned villages and devastated communities behind.
Blood of the Liberator
[This.GetFirstName] is known throughout Nirn for [This.GetHerHis] restless fights against slavery and the suffering it brings.

Blood of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
[This.GetSheHeCap] is known as a great conqueror destined to tread the crowns of Nirn beneath their booted heel.
